file_content.text: I have to contact the Science Bureau at once.
I've finished testing. Your device works.
Of course it works! If it didn't, it probably would have exploded in your hand. At that range, it would have killed you.
That you are alive is a testament to my genius!
Now, if you'll excuse me, I want to see the envy on the faces of my colleagues as I report this success.
Data doesn't collect itself! Go! Test my prototype! And for pity's sake, don't break it!
Unacceptable! You are not at all what I specified on the requisition form!
What am I supposed to do with a Sith Lord? You'll completely invalidate my test results!
A bounty hunter? When I asked for "barely competent cannon fodder"? What are those idiots thinking?
I need expendable test subjects, and someone's clearly spent some time and money training you.
Go back to the bureau. Tell them that when I ask for disposable testers, I mean it!
Haven't we had this conversation once already?
You again?
Don't be ridiculous! I've never seen you before in my life!
I've already done one field test for you. Have you forgotten already?
I tested a device for you.
A field test? Oh, of course! You met my brother Teek! Poor fellow. It must be so hard, being the stupid twin.
Either there are a lot of Neimoidians with attitudes around here, or you've got a serious memory problem.
You are Teek, aren't you?
A lot of... oh, of course! You must have met my twin brother. He's a bit slow, but he tries hard.
Is this some kind of joke?
Clearly, you have me confused with someone else.
Not many people order me around and expect to live. You're either important or crazy.
Who are you?
Your manners need work.
I don't take orders from you.
This is why I always specify "defenseless test subjects."
I am Jeek! I am a tier-six inventor of Research Corps Eight of the Imperial Science Bureau!
My newly completed control core nullifier will subvert droid programming, rendering them harmless. Or it should. It requires testing.
I'll determine if your device is worth the Empire's investment.
Give me the device.
Ah... thank you, my lord. That's very... efficient of you. Do try to be careful with it?
I will test your device. I want to see if it lives up to your claims.
Sounds like fun.
Well, I can't argue without being slaughtered, so thank you, my lord, for your kind offer.
I can take this thing out and put it through its paces, if you pay up.
You got credits? I'll test it.
I suppose that will do. Just try to be careful with that, would you? It's a delicate instrument!
Why don't you let me test it? I'd like to see this device in action.
I could handle that.
Well... I suppose I haven't got a better option, have I? Just try not to break it.
What kind of testing?
There are some hostile droids in the vicinity. They'll have to take some damage to expose their control core.
Once it's unshielded, use the device. Theoretically, it will subdue the droid.
So, go test it. [Refuse quest]
Yes, do that. Let me know if the Science Bureau's test subjects show up.
Away! Away! I'm in the middle of a very delicate experiment, and I won't have you contaminating the results!
